# Green Building Priority Plan Review

To promote green building practices, qualifying residential and commercial projects are eligible for the following benefits during the building plan review process:

  * Immediate plan assignment
  * An assigned county project manager to ensure smooth processing (commercial only)
  * Pre- and post-submission meetings if desired by the design team



## Qualifying criteria include:

  * Compliance with the International Green Construction Code (IgCC)
  * Compliance with the International Energy Conservation Code (IECC) – RESIDENTIAL PROJECTS ONLY (without Virginia Amendments)
  * LEED rating of silver or above Earthcraft select or premium status
  * Three to five “globes” under the Green Globes certification program
  * Living Building Challenge
  * Net Zero Energy Building
  * Passive House Institute US (PHIUS)
  * National Green Building Standard



Submission documents must include verification of the LEED, IgCC, Earthcraft or Green Globe programs with corresponding checklists.

Additionally, self-reported projects may be eligible for recognition under the county’s **Green Building Recognition Program**. If you would like to participate, please contact us at LDSbuildinggreen@fairfaxcounty.gov or **703-324-5175, TTY 711**.

  


  
Need Help? Call **703-222-0801** , **TTY 711**.

Monday through Thursday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. and Friday from 9:15 a.m. to 4 p.m.

  * LDS Permit Library: Access guides to navigate every record type in PLUS.
  * Letters to Industry: Subscribe for LDS announcements, notices, and tech bulletins.
  * Meet With Staff: Find a staff member to help you with the permit process.
